After bitter factional fighting, France appoints Marshal Boucicaut to rule Genoa

Tamerlane destroys an Ottoman army at Ankara, capturing Sultan Bayezid, and recaptures Smyrna for Islam Jean de Bethencourt and Gadifer de la Salle lead a French expedition with Castilian backing to the Canaries
Death of Tamerlane and break-up of his Mongol Empire
All the German Professors secede from the University of Prague and found that of Leipzig

container-title: Its ‘Union’ with the Orthodox is highly unsatisfactory 1415 Portuguese capture Ceuta in Morocco
title: The Poles defeat the Teutonic Order at the battle of Tannenberg September: Henry of Trastamara captures Moorish Antequera 1414–18 Council of Constance condemns Hus, provoking rebellion in Bohemia

container-title: Effective end of Marinid dominance in North Africa Portuguese take Madeira

title: Mamluks raid Cyprus and reduce it to a vassal state 1428 Ottomans conquer Wallachia 1432 Portuguese take the Azores 1434 The Utraquists of Bohemia crush the Taborites 1438–39 Council of Florence concludes a Union with the Orthodox 1439 Ottomans extinguish Serbia
Ottoman attacks on Belgrade are repulsed and John Hunyadi is given much of the credit
The Hungarians wage the successful ‘Long Campaign’ against the Ottomans
Ladislas III and Cardinal Cesarini killed as the Ottomans defeat a crusader army at the battle of Varna
Alfonso IV of Aragon concludes a Treaty with Mamluk Egypt to promote Catalan trade
Civil war in Prussia as the Prussian League, in alliance with Poland, resist the Grand Master of the Teutonic Order
By the Treaty of Thorn the Teutonic Order cedes Danzig and Pomerelia (West
2 April: Ottomans conquer Constantinople French victory at Castillon brings the Hundred Years War to an end A conspiracy of Castilian nobles kills the king’s minister, Alavaro de Luna

By the Nieszawa Privileges Casimir IV makes sweeping concessions to the nobles of Poland 1456 Ottomans driven back from Belgrade by a crusade 1460 Portugal seizes the Cape Verde Islands Ottomans seize control of southern Greece 1462 Henry IV of Castile conquers Gibraltar Novgorod seized by the Grand Duke of Moscow 1468 Ottomans seize Albania
Ottomans conquer the Venetian island of Negroponte, revealing the strength of their fleet
Venice acquires Cyprus on the extinction of its Lusignan dynasty 1470–75 Portuguese explore the Gulf of Guinea
Union of Isabella of Castile and Ferdinand of Aragon Castile dominant in the Canaries 1480 Ottomans conquer Otranto and hold it for a year
Granada seizes Christian Zahara, triggering a Castilian assault
A succession dispute in the Nasrid family of Granada facilitates the Castilian conquest Portuguese reach the Congo river
Ladislas II of Poland guarantees religious freedom to Utraquits and Catholics at the Diet of Kutna Hora
The Portuguese, Bartholemew Diaz, rounds the Cape of Good Hope 1492 Castilian conquest of Granada Expulsion of the Jews from Castile and Aragon Columbus sails to the West Indies

Treaty of Tordesillas divides the New World between Spain and Portugal June: the French invade Italy in the first of a series of Italian wars 1496 John Cabot sails to Newfoundland 1497–99 Vasco da Gama sails to Calcutta
Moriscos (Moors) of Castile given choice of conversion or expulsion
After three years of war Venice loses most of its footholds in Greece to the Ottomans 1505 Castile conquers Mers-el-Kebir 1506 Death of Columbus
Portuguese crush a Muslim fleet off Diu in Gujarat 1510 Castile conquers Tripoli (in modern Libya) 1513 First sighting of the Pacific by Spaniards

note: River Plate Ottomans conquer Mamluk Egypt 1517 Martin Luther posts his ‘95 Theses’ at Wittenberg
title: Popular enthusiasm for the crusade in Hungary provokes the nobles to a civil war in which their enemies are crushed Vasily III of Moscow seizes Smolensk Ottomans crush the Safavid rebellion in Asia Minor 1515 Portuguese seize Ormuz in the Persian Gulf 1516 Spaniards reach the
Ottomans establish a fleet at Avlona on the Adriatic

Charles V inherits a world empire, as Emperor, heir to the Burgundian and Hapsburg lands and king of Spain with its domination in the New World Cortes overthrows the Aztec Empire Portuguese take Malacca 1519–22 First circumnavigation of the globe by Magellan’s expedition
Field of the Cloth of Gold between Henry VIII of England and Francis I of France 1521 Ottomans seize
Hospitallers driven by the Ottomans from their base at Rhodes
Master of the Teutonic Order supports Lutheran ideas and becomes Duke of East Prussia, secularising the lands of the Order

29 August: Ottomans crush Hungary at Mohacs and the kingdom ceases to have a separate existence 1530 Charles V gives Malta to the Hospitallers Protestant princes of Germany form the Schmalkaldic League
Papacy inspires a naval league against the Ottomans in the Adriatic, but this was defeated by 1540 1539 Pizarro overthrows the Inca Empire of Peru

Francis I of France allows an Ottoman fleet to use his bases against Charles V 1545–63 Council of Trent reforms and recasts Catholicism 1551 Ottomans reconquer Tripoli 1557 Portuguese establish Macao in China

container-title: Bohemia, a claim to Hungary and North Italy Treaty of Cateau-Cambrésis confirms Hapsburg supremacy in Europe
title: 1558 Spanish army defeated at Mostaganem in North Africa 1559 Abdication of Charles V Philip inherits Spain, southern Italy, the Netherlands and the New World Ferdinand inherits the Empire

Master of the Teutonic Order in Livonia, embraces Protestantism and becomes duke of Kurland, secularising the lands of the Order 1565 Ottoman expedition fails to take Malta 1566 Ottomans extinguish Genoese hold on Chios 1567 The Low Countries rebel against Philip II 1568–70 Rebellion of the Spanish Moriscos
A Catholic League defeats the Ottoman fleet at Lepanto 1573 Venice accepts the loss of Cyprus to the Ottomans
Sebastian King of Portugal killed in Morocco at Alcazar-Kebir 1600 English found the East India Company 1621 Dutch West India Company founded
Treaty of Zsitva-Torok: Ottoman Sultan recognises the Emperor as his equal A Safavid alliance helps to wear down the Ottomans
English plant their first enduring colony in North America at Jamestown 1625–25 Dutch acquire Manhattan 1609–14 Expulsion of all Moriscos from Spain
Ottoman conquest of Baghdad from the Safavids 1664 French Compagnie des Indes Orientales founded
Venetian Crete conquered by the Ottomans after 20 years of war
Ottoman assault on Vienna defeated with the aid of John Sobieski of Poland
A shell from a Venetian ship explodes the Ottoman magazine in the Parthenon of Athens
After a 15-year war waged by a Holy League organised by the papacy the Ottomans are driven from Hungary and make peace by the Treaty of Carlowitz
Ottomans reconquer all the Venetian gains in southern Greece
